definition[0]: a circle made of gold and decorated with jewels, worn by kings and queens on their heads
definition[1]: a circle, sometimes made of things such as leaves or flowers, worn by someone who has won a special honour
definition[2]: an artificial top for a damaged tooth
definition[3]: the top part of a hat or someoneâ€™s head
example[0]: a hat with a high crown
example[1]: auburn hair piled high on the crown of her head
definition[4]: the top of a hill or something shaped like a hill
example[2]: They drove to the crown of Zion hill and on into town.
example[3]: The masonry at the crown of the arch is paler than on either curve.
definition[5]: the position you have if you have won an important sports competition
example[4]: Can she retain her Wimbledon crown?
example[5]: He went on to win the world crown in 2001.
definition[6]: the standard unit of money in some European countries
definition[7]: an old British coin. Four crowns made a pound.
definition[8]: a mark, sign, badge etc in the shape of a crown, used especially to show rank or quality
definition[9]: to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen
example[7]: Louis was crowned at Reims in 814.
example[8]: In 1896 Nicholas was crowned as Tsar.
definition[10]: to give someone a title for winning a competition
definition[11]: to make something perfect or complete, by adding an achievement etc
example[10]: a long career crowned with a peaceful retirement
definition[12]: to put a protective top on a damaged tooth
definition[13]: to hit someone on the head
definition[14]: the government of a country such as Britain that is officially led by a king or queen
example[11]: The islands are possessions of the Crown.
definition[15]: the English name for a unit of currency used in Denmark, Norway, and Sweden
example[12]: The Swedish drug company had pre-tax profits of 545 million crowns.
